entries.title: Peruvian court upholds 18-month pre-trial detention for Castillo
entries.description: Ex-president Pedro Castillo denounces his arrest as 'political revenge,' while deadly protests continue to rock Peru.

entries.title: ‘Forever a legend’: World pays tribute to Brazilian star Pele
entries.description: Lula and Obama join scores of fans hailing the late football 'king' for his historic influence on and off the pitch.

entries.title: Biden says he looks forward to working with Netanyahu’s new gov’t
entries.description: US president calls Israeli prime minister 'friend for decades', ignores concerns about rise of far-right politicians.

entries.title: Southwest Airlines promises stability after mass US cancellations
entries.description: US Department of Transportation vows to investigate Southwest Airlines for cancellations following severe winter storm.

entries.title: Skills, charisma, mysticism: The life of football legend Pele
entries.description: The world bids farewell to one of the greatest footballers ever seen.

entries.title: Brazilian football icon Pele leaves an unparalleled legacy
entries.description: In his 21-year career, Brazilian footballer became the world's first truly global sporting superstar.

entries.title: ‘The King’ Pele: A lifetime of football memories
entries.description: Pele was feted as 'The King', a title given to him by playwright Nelson Rodrigues when he was just 17.

entries.title: Top Algeria journalist in pretrial detention over funding charges
entries.description: Ihsane El Kadi, who owns a media group and is a vocal critic of the government, has been placed in pretrial detention.

entries.title: Brazilian football legend Pele dies at age 82
entries.description: Pele, who had a tumour removed from his colon last year, passed away in a Sao Paolo hospital, his agent said.

entries.title: How fragile is the peace between Serbs and Kosovars?
entries.description: After weeks of protests, ethnic Serbs in Kosovo have agreed to take down the barricades amid hopes of tensions easing.

entries.title: Brazil’s Lula picks Amazon defender to run environment ministry
entries.description: The Lula government has promised to tackle deforestation, which reached record highs under the Bolsonaro administration.

entries.title: Brazil’s haunting graveyard of ships risks environmental disaster
entries.description: The Guanabara Bay by Rio de Janeiro and Niteroi, once a haven for wildlife, is now a cemetery for abandoned ships.

entries.title: Belarus summons Ukraine envoy over stray air defence missile
entries.description: Minsk says it downed a Ukrainian S-300 air defence missile amid a wave of Russian attacks on cities across Ukraine.

entries.title: Who are the ministers leading Israel’s new far-right government?
entries.description: Top ministers in Israel's new right-wing, religiously conservative cabinet headed by Netanyahu include illegal settlers.

entries.title: Bulgaria protests to Russia after journalist put on wanted list
entries.description: Russian envoy summoned as PM calls targeting of investigative reporter Christo Grozev 'an attack on freedom of speech'.

entries.title: Kosovo-Serbia tensions: Mood on the ground, possible scenarios
entries.description: Analysts say heightened friction in the Balkans may serve the Kremlin's interests but cast doubt over a show of force.

entries.title: Indian pharma under scrutiny again after 18 Uzbek child deaths
entries.description: Among the world's biggest rug exporters, India is investigating the firm whose cough syrup has been linked to the deaths

entries.title: Setbacks swamped Donald Trump in 2022. Can he recover?
entries.description: The year saw the former president face damaging political and legal crises as he announced his 2024 presidential run.

entries.title: Italy orders COVID tests for China arrivals, EU seeks common rule
entries.description: Italy imposes mandatory testing for air passengers from China, but other EU countries seem reluctant to follow suit.

entries.title: Italy tightens rules for asylum seeker rescue ships
entries.description: New measures could see charities who rescue asylum seekers at sea fined and their ships impounded.

entries.title: Why there won’t be a ‘Hollywood ending’ to the Ukraine war
entries.description: Russia and Ukraine will soon have to make awkward compromises if they don’t want their conflict to become a forever war.

entries.title: Middle East round-up: To move forward, we look back on 2022
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: Who is Israel’s new Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu?
entries.description: Israel's longest-serving premier has ushered in the country's most religious and hardline government in history.

entries.title: ‘Senseless barbarism’: Russian missiles batter Ukraine’s cities
entries.description: Explosions rock Kyiv as Moscow launches wave of attacks stretching from Kharkiv in the east to Lviv in the west.

entries.title: Israel is weaponising Palestinian children’s rights
entries.description: Instead of disregarding child rights and international law, Israel is using them to perfect and justify its violence.

entries.title: At least five killed in South Korea road tunnel fire
entries.description: The blaze broke out after a freight truck collided with a bus on a highway near Seoul, injuring 37.

entries.title: US clears sale of $180m anti-tank systems to Taiwan
entries.description: Taiwan says the sale will boost the island's capacity for 'asymmetric warfare' amid escalating tensions with China.

entries.title: Countries imposing COVID rules for travellers from China
entries.description: The US, Italy and other countries introduce restrictions after surge in infections in China.

entries.title: Netanyahu to be sworn in as head of new far-right Israeli gov’t
entries.description: Israel's incoming government has raised fears among Palestinians and liberal Israelis.

entries.title: Russia rejects Zelenskyy’s ‘peace formula’: Lavrov
entries.description: Zelenskyy's 10-point peace plan envisages Russia restoring Ukraine's territorial integrity.

entries.title: From drugs to funds, volunteers key for Russian army in Ukraine
entries.description: Burgeoning volunteer movement has taken on increasingly prominent role in supplying Russian troops fighting in Ukraine.

entries.title: Japan eases COVID curbs on flights from Hong Kong after backlash
entries.description: Hong Kong travellers will be able to fly into three more Japanese airports than previously as measures eased.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 309
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 309th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Russia plans to disrupt Western arms supplies to Ukraine: Lavrov
entries.description: Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said 'railway lines, bridges and tunnels' considered targets in stopping arms shipments.

entries.title: China to import 45 foreign video games, grants multiple licences
entries.description: Moves mark latest easing of rigid curbs that have hammered China's gaming industry since August last year.

entries.title: ‘Suicidal thoughts strike every day’: India’s sextortion scourge
entries.description: Sexual blackmail schemes are spreading from the upper echelons of Indian society to the poor and working class.

entries.title: At least 10 dead after fire rips through Cambodia hotel-casino
entries.description: The blaze started on the first floor and spread quickly along carpets before engulfing the multi-storey complex.

entries.title: UN halts some operations in Afghanistan over women aid worker ban
entries.description: 'Female staff are key to every aspect of the humanitarian response in Afghanistan,' UN agencies and aid groups said.

entries.title: Australia to extradite ex-US fighter pilot over China training
entries.description: Former US pilot faces charges of conspiracy to export defence services to China over training of military pilots.

entries.title: Protesting Serbs in northern Kosovo agree to remove barricades
entries.description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said the dismantling of barricades that have blocked roads will begin on Thursday.

entries.title: Twitter suffers major outage, leaving users unable to log on
entries.description: Users attempting to log on to the microblogging site on Wednesday greeted with error message.

entries.title: Argentina identifies another child kidnapped during dictatorship
entries.description: The confirmation is the second to occur in less than a week, bringing the total number of identified children to 132.
